Study Area
The study area includes four distinct basins (Figure 1), of which Drin and Drina are river basins and Prespa and Skadar are lake basins.
IWI riparian zones (RZ, Figure 2).

Functional components
The functional components (Figure 3A) reflect the integrity of the individual environmental systems of a watershed.

The regions with the lowest ICI values (Fig. 3B) were near the confluence of the Drina and the Sava and in NW Albania, while those with the highest ICI values were within the Dinaric Alps (central Montenegro, SE Bosnia, N and E Albania).

In terms of biogeographic zones (Figure 1), the mean Alpine ICI was 0.53 (SD = 0.15), the mean ICI of the Mediterranean Zone was 0.46 (SD = 0.18), and the mean ICI of the Continental Zone was 0.34 (SD = 0.13).
Similar to the ICI results, IWI spatial trends (Figure 3C) were largely influenced by biogeographic zone (Figure 1).
This variability between the functional components (Figure 3A) can be useful to national managers (see 4.2 Management Applications).

Given that cultural services such as recreation or stewardship are regularly managed at the local scale (Plieninger et al. 2013), whereas regulating services, such as river flood mitigation, are often managed at the national or international scale (Stürck et al. 2014), the levels of information provided by the ICI and the IWI of streams, watersheds, and basins inform the respective local, national, and international management entities (Figure 4).
The three levels of information additionally accommodate scientific recommendations to manage aquatic features at multiple ecological scales (Figure 4) (Allan et al. 1997; De Groot et al. 2010).
By identifying the functional component with the lowest value in an individual catchment or watershed, the national management authority can identify the individual source(s) of stress (Figure 3A).

Hill et al. (Hill et al. 2017) suggest that the success of biological resource management would increase if management targeted areas with low catchment integrity and high watershed integrity (Figure 3D).
To increase restoration feasibility, managers can identify catchments with high IWI values (the blue and green catchments identified in Figure 3D).
